description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the remote code execution vulnerability in the Windows mobile broadband driver (CVE-2024-43526):

1. Identify your Windows version and corresponding build number from the list below to ensure compatibility.

   - Windows 11 Version 24H2 for x64-based Systems: KB5044284
   - Windows 11 Version 23H2 for x64-based Systems: KB5044285
   - Windows 11 Version 22H2 for x64-based Systems: KB5044280
   - Windows 11 Version 21H2 for x64-based Systems: KB5044280
   - Windows 10 Version 22H2 for x64-based Systems: KB5044273
   - Windows 10 Version 21H2 for x64-based Systems: KB5044273

2. Download and apply the appropriate update from the official Microsoft Update Catalog using the following links:
   - [KB5044273](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044273)
   - [KB5044284](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044284)
   - [KB5044285](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044285)
   - [KB5044280](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044280)

3. Restart your system to ensure all changes take effect.

**Details**:
- This update addresses vulnerabilities stemming from improper input validation and heap-based buffer overflow, primarily affecting the Windows mobile broadband driver and enabling potential remote code execution.

**Preconditions**:
- Verify your system's compatibility with the stated update versions. Backup critical data before proceeding with the installation.
